alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 5:16AM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in San Francisco CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. For the SALINAS RIVER...including Bradley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM PST Friday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue rising to 14.9 feet early Saturday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM PST.
